{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3602429,"name":"Mike Reilly","username":"MikeReilly06","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mikereilly06/{size}/161789_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-24T15:16:20.937Z","cooked":"

Hello all -

Happy “Rebuilt” Season! (We all know there’s no break, the next season starts when the previous ends.).

I’m trying to walk through the intro to programming steps to draft out a bit more clarity for our newbies. I’ve done this since 2005, so I swear I know what I’m doing. However, maybe I don’t.

I’ve build the kitbot (old one), written code for simple Tank Drive with Xbox controllers (Java). Using TalonSRX motor controllers.

In short, the robot will only read positive values from the XBox axes, and when it does it’s only about half the speed. I have checked the calibration of the XBox controller, even swapped out 3 to triple check.

I have even flashed the microSD in the roboRio to be brand spanking new.

What I’m wondering: is there some other setting like an “offset”, that is not reading the joysticks properly? They show in the drivers’ station as range from -1 to +1, and print out those values accordingly, but the robot only drives one direction, and only half speed. The direction is in the positive direction of the joystick, even when inverting motors.

I do have a single, separate CIM for an “intake” that responds appropriately to the A and Y buttons.

Hoping it’s some stupid little thing. Glad I’m doing this before I walk the newbies through!

What’s your code look like? And if it matters, are the Talons using CAN or PWM?

P.S. I think there are config options to limit the max speed (maybe in each direction?) in the Tuner tool, what are those set to?

As for “looks like”, I’ve done a Timed Robot as well as Command Based, same results, making me think it’s something hardware or firmware.

Using CAN.

For those interested, the solution was simple, the kind I anticipated since the code was too simple to be the problem: TalonSRX calibration to the joystick. I restored them to default with a simple reboot on each motor controller: https://ctre.download/files/user-manual/Talon%20SRX%20User’s%20Guide.pdf

Sometimes it’s just one little step that you forget about. Thanks to those who offered assistance.
